class junctiontree.JunctionTree(clusters, cluster_tuples, complete_graph)[source]¶

class containing a junction tree

show_tree()[source]¶

shows the tree

class junctiontree.JunctionTreeFromBayesianGraph(graph: networkx.classes.graph.Graph)[source]¶

Creates a Junction Tree from possibly cycled directed bayesian graph.

Consider a following product of factors

Based on the above factors we create the following list of vactors as an input to the algrithm creating a Junction Tree.

C = [(1, 2, 4), (2, 3, 4), (4, 5), (4, 6, 7), (1, 7)]

This representation requires usage of the alternative constructor provided by the static method from_c_dict.

Running the Junction Tree algorithm over the above dictionary representation of the bayesian graph yields

Default constructor takes as input a list of nodes and a list of 2-tuples representing edges. By default the graph is undirected. However even the directed graph is first internally converted to undirected graph and subsequently moralized.

Parameters

  • nodes (List) – list of nodes

  • edges (List[Tuple]) – list of edges (2-tuples)

compute() → junctiontree.JunctionTree[source]¶

Executes the complete algorithm forming the JunctionTree object at the end. This is the main API function.

Return type

JunctionTree

compute_given_elimination_ordering(elimination_ordering: List) → junctiontree.JunctionTree[source]¶

Executes the complete algorithm given predefined elimination ordering forming the JunctionTree object at the end. This is the main API function.

Return type

JunctionTree

create_elimination_ordering() → List[int][source]¶

Find repeatedly vertex with minimal elimination cost, create elimination ordering.

Return type

List[int]

find_clusters(elimination_ordering: List[int]) → List[List][source]¶

Find clusters in a moral graph using elimination ordering.

Parameters

elimination_ordering (List[int]) – the elimination ordering as returned by the method create_eliminatioin_ordering

Return type

List[List]

classmethod from_c_dict(C: Dict[int, List]) → junctiontree.JunctionTreeFromBayesianGraph[source]¶

Creates a moral graph from a dictionary representing the directed bayesian graph. In this representation each node has to be exactly one time as head.

Parameters

C (Dict[int, List]) – input dictonary with heads ad keys and tails as values

Returns

an object of JunctionTreeFromBayesianGraph type

Return type

JunctionTreeFromBayesianGraph

classmethod from_factors(factors: List[Tuple]) → junctiontree.JunctionTreeFromBayesianGraph[source]¶

Creates cliques for each factor - a moral graph.

Parameters

factors (List[Tuple]) – a list of tuples, each tuple contains factor variables labels (ints)

Returns

an object of JunctionTreeFromBayesianGraph type

Return type

JunctionTreeFromBayesianGraph

Using clusters tuples without duplicates, calculates complete graph using minimum spanning tree algorithm.
